NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..1QICore Practitioner Role Extension
extension S0..1ExtensionOrganization where the roles are available
url 1..1uri"organization"
valueReference 0..1Reference(QICore-BodySite)
extension S0..*ExtensionRoles which this practitioner may perform
url 1..1uri"code"
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptBinding: PractitionerRole (example)
extension S0..*ExtensionSpecific specialty of the practitioner
url 1..1uri"specialty"
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptBinding: Practice Setting Code Value Set (preferred)
extension 0..1ExtensionprimaryInd

Fixed Value: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/practitionerrole-primaryInd
extension S0..1ExtensionThe period during which the practitioner is authorized to perform in these role(s)
url 1..1uri"period"
valuePeriod 0..1Period
extension 0..*ExtensionThe location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.
url 1..1uri"location"
valueLocation 0..1Reference(QICore-Location)

Documentation for this format

name: practitioner-role
title: practitioner-role
publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - FHIR WG

element.definition: Roles/organizations the practitioner is associated with.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension

element.short: Organization where the roles are performed
element.definition: The organization where the Practitioner performs the roles associated.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.short: Roles which this practitioner may perform
element.definition: Roles which this practitioner is authorized to perform for the organization.

binding.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the role of a Practitioner.

element.definition: Specific specialty of the practitioner.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
Flag indicating if the specialty is the primary specialty of the provider. Normally, a practitioner will have one primary specialty, but in some cases more than one can be primary.
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

binding.description: This is the code representing the clinical specialty of the clinician or provider who interacted with, treated, or provided a service to/for the patient. The value set used for clinical specialty has been limited by HITSP to the value set reproduced from HITSP C80 Table 2-149 Clinical Specialty Value Set Definition.

element.short: The period during which the person is authorized to act as a practitioner in these role(s) for the organization.
element.definition: The period during which the practitioner is authorized to perform in these role(s).
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

QICore PractitionerRole extension for Practitioner profile

element.short: Organization where the roles are available
element.definition: The organization where the Practitioner performs the roles associated.

element.short: Roles which this practitioner may perform
element.definition: Roles which this practitioner is authorized to perform for the organization.

binding.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the role of a Practitioner.

element.definition: Specific specialty of the practitioner

binding.description: This is the code representing the clinical specialty of the clinician or provider who interacted with, treated, or provided a service to/for the patient. The value set used for clinical specialty has been limited by HITSP to the value set reproduced from HITSP C80 Table 2-149 Clinical Specialty Value Set Definition.

element.definition: Flag indicating if the specialty is the primary specialty of the provider. Normally, a practitioner will have one primary specialty, but in some cases more than one can be primary.

element.short: The period during which the practitioner is authorized to perform in these role(s)
element.definition: The period during which the person is authorized to act as a practitioner in these role(s) for the organization.

element.short: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.
element.definition: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.
